response.original_title: California Security Alert: Resolving McAfee Error 0x80040154 and "Class Not Registered
response.overview: California Expert Desk: 1-855-508-8955 Technical Root Cause Analysis: In 2026, California users are facing a surge in Error 0x80040154. Technically, this is a COM (Component Object Model) registration failure. When McAfee attempts to call a critical DLL (like ExplorerFrame.dll) to initialize the scanning UI, the Windows Registry fails to provide the entry point. This is often caused by an interrupted 2026 Windows 11 Cumulative Update that "orphans" the registry keys, leaving your antivirus dashboard blank and unresponsive. Advanced Restoration Protocols: DLL Re-registration: Open an elevated Command Prompt and run regsvr32 on the problematic McAfee components to re-index the COM objects. DCOM Permission Audit: Use dcomcnfg to verify that the McAfee Trust Process has the necessary "Launch and Activation" permissions. WMI Repository Repair: Rebuild the Windows Management Instrumentation database to allow the OS to recognize and launch security services properly.
response.tagline: California Security Alert: Resolving McAfee Error 0x80040154 and "Class Not Registered
response.title: California Security Alert: Resolving McAfee Error 0x80040154 and "Class Not Registered
